ingredients: Whole spices: 4 cloves, 2 cardamom pods, 1 bay leaf, 1-inch cinnamon stick, 1 star anise, 4 black peppercorns

steps.title: Prepare Marinade
steps.description: In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a marinade.

steps.title: Marinate Chicken
steps.description: Add chicken pieces to the marinade along with green chilies, half of the mint and coriander leaves. Mix thoroughly and cover. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.

steps.title: Slice and Fry Onions
steps.description: Thinly slice the onions. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat and fry the onions in batches until golden brown and crispy.

steps.title: Drain Fried Onions
steps.description: Remove fried onions and place on paper towels to absorb excess oil. Set aside half for layering later.

steps.title: Add Onions to Marinade
steps.description: Mix the remaining half of the fried onions into the marinated chicken.

steps.title: Rinse and Soak Rice
steps.description: Rinse basmati rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.

steps.title: Prepare Saffron Milk
steps.description: Warm the milk slightly and add saffron strands. Let it sit for 10–15 minutes to release color and aroma.

steps.title: Boil Water with Whole Spices
steps.description: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add salt and whole spices (cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, cinnamon, star anise, peppercorns).

steps.title: Parboil the Rice
steps.description: Drain soaked rice and add it to the boiling spiced water. Cook until the rice is 70% done—grains should still be slightly firm. Drain the rice immediately.

steps.title: Prepare for Layering
steps.description: Grease the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with a little ghee. Spread the marinated chicken evenly as the bottom layer.

steps.title: Layer the Rice
steps.description: Spread the parboiled rice evenly over the chicken layer.

steps.title: Add Final Garnishes
steps.description: Top with the reserved fried onions, remaining mint and coriander leaves, saffron milk, and drizzle with ghee.

steps.title: Seal the Pot
steps.description: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid or seal the edges with dough to trap steam inside.

steps.title: Cook on High and Low Heat
steps.description: Place the sealed pot on high heat for 5 minutes. Then reduce to very low heat and let cook (dum) for 25–30 minutes.

steps.title: Rest the Biryani
steps.description: Turn off the heat and let the biryani sit for 10 minutes to settle and absorb flavors.

steps.title: Serve
steps.description: Gently fluff the rice with a flat spoon without breaking the grains. Serve hot with raita, salad, or mirchi ka salan.
